body_html:
I have been trying to install tensorflow on an EC2 instance based on these instructions, and keep getting a similar error to the ones discussed above:

ERROR: /mnt/tmp/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/BUILD:87:1: //tensorflow/core:protos_all_py: no such attribute 'imports' in 'py_library' rule. ERROR: /mnt/tmp/tensorflow/tensorflow/cc/BUILD:61:1: Target '//tensorflow/core:all_kernels' contains an error and its package is in error and referenced by '//tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer'. ERROR: Loading failed; build aborted.

Unfortunately, @vrv 's fix does not seem to work, and neither does retrying with a fresh master source. Any thoughts?

body:
I have been trying to install tensorflow on an EC2 instance based on [these instructions](http://eatcodeplay.com/installing-gpu-enabled-tensorflow-with-python-3-4-in-ec2/), and keep getting a similar error to the ones discussed above: 

`ERROR: /mnt/tmp/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/BUILD:87:1: //tensorflow/core:protos_all_py: no such attribute 'imports' in 'py_library' rule.
ERROR: /mnt/tmp/tensorflow/tensorflow/cc/BUILD:61:1: Target '//tensorflow/core:all_kernels' contains an error and its package is in error and referenced by '//tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer'.
ERROR: Loading failed; build aborted.`

Unfortunately, @vrv 's fix does not seem to work, and neither does retrying with a fresh master source. Any thoughts?
